summary: This bill, the Muhammad Ali Congressional Gold Medal Act, proposes to posthumously award a Congressional Gold Medal to Muhammad Ali in recognition of his contributions to the United States.  The bill outlines Ali's life, highlighting his achievements as a boxer, his advocacy for civil rights, his humanitarian work, and his role as a global icon. Provisions include instructions for the medal's design, presentation, and potential sale of bronze duplicates.  The bill also designates the medal as a national medal, subject to relevant United States Code.
